00037     // Match a single ctype predicate.
00038     const char* space(const char* src);
00039     const char* alpha(const char* src);
00040     const char* digit(const char* src);
00041     const char* xdigit(const char* src);
00042     const char* alnum(const char* src);
00043     const char* punct(const char* src);
00044     const char* unicode(const char* src);
00045     const char* character(const char* src);

00052     const char* no_spaces(const char* src);
00053     const char* optional_spaces(const char* src);

00055     // Match any single character (/./).
00056     const char* any_char(const char* src);
00057 
00058     // Assert word boundary (/\b/)
00059     // Is a zero-width positive lookaheads
00060     const char* word_boundary(const char* src);
00061 
00062     // Match a single linebreak (/(?:\n|\r\n?)/).
00063     const char* re_linebreak(const char* src);
00064 
00065     // Assert string boundaries (/\Z|\z|\A/)
00066     // There are zero-width positive lookaheads
00067     const char* end_of_line(const char* src);
00068     // const char* end_of_string(const char* src);
00069     // const char* start_of_string(const char* src);
00070 
00071     // Type definition for prelexer functions
00072     typedef const char* (*prelexer)(const char*);
00073 
00074     //####################################
00075     // BASIC "REGEX" CONSTRUCTORS
00076     //####################################
00077 
00078     // Match a single character literal.
00079     // Regex equivalent: /(?:literal)/
00080     template <char chr>
00081     const char* exactly(const char* src) {
00082       return *src == chr ? src + 1 : 0;
00083     }
00084 
00085     // Match a string constant.
00086     // Regex equivalent: /[axy]/
00087     template <const char* str>
00088     const char* exactly(const char* src) {
00089       if (str == 0) return 0;
00090       const char* pre = str;
00091       if (src == 0) return 0;
00092       // there is a small chance that the search string
00093       // is longer than the rest of the string to look at
00094       while (*pre && *src == *pre) {
00095         ++src, ++pre;
00096       }
00097       return *pre ? 0 : src;
00098     }
00099 
00100     // Match for members of char class.
00101     // Regex equivalent: /[axy]/
00102     template <const char* char_class>
00103     const char* class_char(const char* src) {
00104       const char* cc = char_class;
00105       while (*cc && *src != *cc) ++cc;
00106       return *cc ? src + 1 : 0;
00107     }
00108 
00109     // Match for members of char class.
00110     // Regex equivalent: /[axy]/
00111     template <const char* char_class>
00112     const char* class_chars(const char* src) {
00113       const char* p = src;
00114       while (class_char<char_class>(p)) ++p;
00115       return p == src ? 0 : p;
00116     }
00117 
00118     // Match all except the supplied one.
00119     // Regex equivalent: /[^x]/
00120     template <const char chr>
00121     const char* any_char_but(const char* src) {
00122       return (*src && *src != chr) ? src + 1 : 0;
00123     }
00124 
00125     // Succeeds if the matcher fails.
00126     // Aka. zero-width negative lookahead.
00127     // Regex equivalent: /(?!literal)/
00128     template <prelexer mx>
00129     const char* negate(const char* src) {
00130       return mx(src) ? 0 : src;
00131     }
00132 
00133     // Succeeds if the matcher succeeds.
00134     // Aka. zero-width positive lookahead.
00135     // Regex equivalent: /(?=literal)/
00136     // just hangs around until we need it
00137     template <prelexer mx>
00138     const char* lookahead(const char* src) {
00139       return mx(src) ? src : 0;
00140     }
00141 
00142     // Tries supplied matchers in order.
00143     // Succeeds if one of them succeeds.
00144     // Regex equivalent: /(?:FOO|BAR)/
00145     template <prelexer... mxs>
00146     const char* alternatives(const char* src) {
00147       const char* rslt;
00148       for (prelexer mx : { mxs... }) {
00149         if ((rslt = mx(src))) return rslt;
00150       }
00151       return 0;
00152     }
00153 
00154     // Tries supplied matchers in order.
00155     // Succeeds if all of them succeeds.
00156     // Regex equivalent: /(?:FOO)(?:BAR)/
00157     template <prelexer... mxs>
00158     const char* sequence(const char* src) {
00159       const char* rslt = src;
00160       for (prelexer mx : { mxs... }) {
00161         if (!(rslt = mx(rslt))) return 0;
00162       }
00163       return rslt;
00164     }
00165 
00166     // Match a pattern or not. Always succeeds.
00167     // Regex equivalent: /(?:literal)?/
00168     template <prelexer mx>
00169     const char* optional(const char* src) {
00170       const char* p = mx(src);
00171       return p ? p : src;
00172     }
00173 
00174     // Match zero or more of the patterns.
00175     // Regex equivalent: /(?:literal)*/
00176     template <prelexer mx>
00177     const char* zero_plus(const char* src) {
00178       const char* p = mx(src);
00179       while (p) src = p, p = mx(src);
00180       return src;
00181     }
00182 
00183     // Match one or more of the patterns.
00184     // Regex equivalent: /(?:literal)+/
00185     template <prelexer mx>
00186     const char* one_plus(const char* src) {
00187       const char* p = mx(src);
00188       if (!p) return 0;
00189       while (p) src = p, p = mx(src);
00190       return src;
00191     }
00192 
00193     // Match mx non-greedy until delimiter.
00194     // Other prelexers are greedy by default.
00195     // Regex equivalent: /(?:$mx)*?(?=$delim)\b/
00196     template <prelexer mx, prelexer delim>
00197     const char* non_greedy(const char* src) {
00198       while (!delim(src)) {
00199         const char* p = mx(src);
00200         if (p == src) return 0;
00201         if (p == 0) return 0;
00202         src = p;
00203       }
00204       return src;
00205     }
00206 
00207     //####################################
00208     // ADVANCED "REGEX" CONSTRUCTORS
00209     //####################################
00210 
00211     // Match with word boundary rule.
00212     // Regex equivalent: /(?:$mx)\b/
00213     template <const char* str>
00214     const char* word(const char* src) {
00215       return sequence <
00216                exactly < str >,
00217                word_boundary
00218              >(src);
00219     }
00220 
00221     template <char chr>
00222     const char* loosely(const char* src) {
00223       return sequence <
00224                optional_spaces,
00225                exactly < chr >
00226              >(src);
00227     }
00228     template <const char* str>
00229     const char* loosely(const char* src) {
00230       return sequence <
00231                optional_spaces,
00232                exactly < str >
00233              >(src);
00234     }
00235 
00236   }
00237 }
